title: Elm Integration with Plutus
description: Haskell can be difficult to work with for beginners, and Plutus development could benefit from simpler patterns for designing applications.

f6_assessments.q0: As with the pony project by the same proposer, This seems like an interesting project to explore the ability to integrate Plutus with Pony. Given the tiny cost of 6000, it seems like it worth the risk to see what comes out of it.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer claims to have good experience. The plan is to work on integration over a period of 12 months. Whilst success is no guaranteed, the proposer seems very motivated and dedicated to the project and is asking for a pretty small sum.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer has given a plan with time line for delivering the implementation and documentation which will be published open source to git hub. This will make it easy to audit activity. Whilst the deliverables a re a little vague, the funding request is also quite small. No metrics or goals have been provided. It would nice to see some goals set for the number of dev's to use what is produced going forward.

f6_assessments.q0: Learning the Haskell programming language can be a hurdle to start developing Cardano smart contracts. Elm is an easier programming language to learn and has a growing community worldwide. This proposal can improve the Cardano development environment, make it more attractive, and help attract a new group of developers
f6_assessments.q1: Experience in Haskell programming and ELM programming language are basic requirements for the implementation of this proposal. The initiator has great experience in both topics. I believe that this project can be successfully implemented and that the Cardano community will help to solve possible problems in the development phase.
f6_assessments.q2: Although the milestones could be described a bit more granularly in the timeline, the description can be used to track the progress and success of the proposal.

solution: Elm's semantics are a subset of Haskell's... Marlowe AST is valid Elm code... The goal is converting Elm code to Plutus Core or Haskell.
experience: 4+ years of Elm development. 15+ years of functional programming. Countless hours reading the Haskell code of the Elm compiler.. Plutus too.
